alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Livingston County through 715 PM CDT... At 644 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Forrest, or near Chatsworth and Fairbury, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fairbury, Chatsworth and Forrest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
